item.title: Stuff I Enjoy Mc Pt1
item.description: Welcome to the first installment of Stuff I Enjoy! I was going to postpone this to next week but decided against it. This installment is dedicated to Minecraft, a game that shaped my entire youth. I started playing Minecraft in 2011, around the time that Beta 1.7.3 dropped. It wasn’t until Beta 1.8 that I actually started getting more into it. Why? When I first booted it up, I created a survival world but didn’t know how to break blocks.

item.title: What Do I Like
item.description: Lately, I’ve been trying to get into writing more. My friends Adrian, Alwinfy, and Willie encouraged me to start writing blog posts as it would be a decent way to get started. I thought about it for a while and concluded that they were right. Taking up blogging would be nice. But then, I ran into my first blocker. What would I write? My first instinct was to do some online searching about it, as it was unlikely that I was the only person who didn’t know what to blog.

item.title: Games
item.description: Index Completed Currently playing Dropped To play Inspired by my friend Williewillus every time I finish a game from today (November 20th 2020) onwards I will post a short review on my blog and update the table below with a the review score and a link to the review. (Keep in mind I will not retroactively add past played games since that would be a huge chore) Completed games Name Platform Genres Rating /10 Unreal Life Adventure 8 Currently Playing Name Platform Yakuza Zero PC Adventures to Go PSP Kingdom Hearts: Birth by Sleep PSP Kirby Nightmare in Dreamland GBA Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney NDS The World Ends With You NDS Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild Switch Yoshi’s Crafted World Switch Dropped Name Platform Okami HD PC To Play Name Platform

item.title: About
item.description: Who am I? Hi! My name is Emanuel Ferraz, better known on the internet as Kamefrede. I’m a software developer from Gondomar, Portugal. What kind of software do you develop? In my day job, I mostly maintain legacy codebases(mostly C# and JS) and develop tailor-made software for various different clients(factories, restaurants, etc..). In my spare time, I mostly do Minecraft modding in both Java and Kotlin(I was going to try Clojure, but it was too much of a pain to get it to work).

item.title: Hello Internet
item.description: After much delaying, I finally caved in and set up a website for real. This is my 3rd attempt at a website, I think. The first attempt went badly since I was trying to minimize the use of Javascript but I still wanted to have fancy animations and navbars and whatnot. For my second attempt I realized that I didn’t need any of that fanciness and was recommended by my friend Williewillus to check out both Jekyll and Hugo.
